Missouri bills database for 2000 to 2022

This table contains bills truly agreed and finally passed during sessions from 2000 to 2022. The lists were compiled from the Missouri House of Representatives past session archive and contains bills from both the state house and senate.

After downloaded from the state house website, two columns were added including the general assembly and session. All files for each session were combined into one for an easily searchable database. Columns names have been reorganized and edited for clarity.

This project was created as a part of 2,500 Below â€” a series of coverage about the changing landscape of Missouri's small towns.

How to use this table: Use the search bar to search for topics or words that would appear in the "Bill Long Title" column. The search bar is not case sensitive and can search multiple words or phrases. If you find an error, please let us know at ajennemann@mail.missouri.edu.

Download the spreadsheet

Bill Bill Long Title Last Action Date Year Sponsor Sponsor District Co-Sponsor Co-Sponsor District Last Action Last Activity Comments General assembly Session Bill String LR Number
HB 1077 Repeals peripheral zoning for Cameron. 6/27/00 2000 Relford, Randall 6 Delivered to Secretary of State (G) 90 Second regular HB 1077 2569L.01T
HB 1082 Allows federal government to acquire land by eminent domain in this state for reforestation, recreational or agricultural uses only upon statutory approval by General Assembly. 7/13/00 2000 Crump, Wayne 152 Delivered to Secretary of State (G) 90 Second regular SS SCS HB 1082 2627S.06T
HB 1085 Exempts mental health residential facilities and day programs accredited by the Council on Accreditation from the licensing requirements of the Department of Health. 6/27/00 2000 Selby, Harold 105 Delivered to Secretary of State (G) 90 Second regular HB 1085 2476L.01T
